titles.title: Social Security Disability Determination Simplification Act of 2003
To amend title II of the Social Security Act to eliminate reconsideration as an intervening step between initial benefit entitlement decisions and subsequent hearings on the record on such decisions.
Social Security Disability Determination Simplification Act of 2003

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Social Security.

term.name: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

bill.summary: Social Security Disability Determination Simplification Act of 2003 - Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) (OASDI) of the Social Security Act to eliminate the reconsideration step in the review process governing decisions on benefit entitlement. Makes opportunity for a hearing with respect to any initial decision or determination available without any requirement for intervening reconsideration.
